info.senderName: NWS El Paso Tx/Santa Teresa NM
info.headline: Dust Advisory issued July 18 at 5:58PM MDT until July 18 at 7:00PM MDT by NWS El Paso Tx/Santa Teresa NM
info.description:
The National Weather Service in El Paso has issued a
* Dust Advisory for... Southwestern Dona Ana County in south central New Mexico...
* Until 700 PM MDT.
* At 558 PM MDT, an area of blowing dust over Las Cruces and surrounding areas.
HAZARD...Less than two miles visibility with strong winds up to 45 mph.
SOURCE...Detected by National Weather Service meteorologists.
IMPACT...Hazardous travel.
* This includes the following highways... Interstate 10 in New Mexico between mile markers 120 and 154. Interstate 25 in New Mexico between mile markers 2 and 7. Highway 70 in New Mexico between mile markers 150 and 153.
Locations impacted include... Las Cruces, Vado, NMSU Main Campus, Mesquite, Mesilla, San Miguel, Fairacres, Talavera, La Mesa, Afton Generating Plant, East Mesa, San Pablo, Picacho, Corralitos, Northeast Las Cruces, Las Cruces West Mesa, Southern New Mexico State Fairgrounds, Mesilla Valley Bosque State Park, and Aden Crater.
info.instruction: Blowing dust brings reduced visibility, leading to dangerous driving conditions. If driving, avoid blowing dust if possible. If caught in dense blowing dust, pull off the road, turn off your lights and keep your foot off the brake.
